input:
Lyon 0 - 2 Zenit

First Half:

11:21 Event: Throw-in by Zenit
11:25 Event: Foul by Lyon
11:58 Caption: Mapou Yanga-Mbiwa (Lyon) gives away a foul for a fierce tackle on an opponent. Zenit win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.
12:02 Event: Direct free-kick by Zenit
12:07 Caption: The free kick is taken by Danny (Zenit St Petersburg), but ball is cleared.
12:08 Event: Ball out of play
12:32 Event: Throw-in by Zenit
12:41 Event: Ball out of play
12:51 Caption: What a poor attempt! Domenico Criscito (Zenit St Petersburg) drives another shot towards goal - this time from further out, but it couldn't have been worse if he had shot blindfolded. The ball goes into the stands.
12:56 Event: Clearance by Lyon
12:59 Caption: There was no time for the supporters to get bored during the game as it was full of action and thrilling moments. The game was quite balanced and neither team had any obvious advantage. The home side attempted to create scoring opportunities mostly with long balls, while the opposition focused on counter-attacks to breach the home side's defences.
13:04 Event: Offside by Zenit
13:08 Caption: The game is interrupted as Hulk (Zenit St Petersburg) is flagged offside.
13:21 Event: Ball out of play
13:26 Event: Throw-in by Lyon
13:30 Event: Ball out of play
13:38 Event: Throw-in by Lyon
13:55 Event: Foul by Lyon
14:06 Caption: Felix Brych interrupts the game for a tactical foul by Alexandre Lacazette (Lyon). Zenit have a free kick from a promising distance.
14:33 Event: Direct free-kick by Zenit
14:43 Caption: Hulk (Zenit St Petersburg) whips in the resulting set piece but it's cleared.
14:57 Event: Ball out of play
14:59 Event: Throw-in by Zenit
15:10 Event: Throw-in by Lyon
15:31 Event: Foul by Lyon
15:33 Caption: Christophe Jallet sends a lovely lofted pass forward that flies over the top of the defence and into the path of Claudio Beauvue (Lyon), but he can't direct his header on target as it flies well wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Zenit.
16:01 Event: Indirect free-kick by Zenit
16:19 Event: Ball out of play
16:22 Event: Throw-in by Zenit
16:29 Caption: Some great controlled play and passing from Zenit. They are increasing their possession of the ball and trying to open up the opposition's defence to hit them swiftly on the break.
16:59 Event: Shots on target by Zenit
17:12 Caption: Domenico Criscito (Zenit St Petersburg) wastes a good opportunity as his pass into the box is blocked by the defence.
17:14 Event: Ball out of play
17:18 Event: Throw-in by Lyon
18:10 Event: Shots on target by Lyon
18:10 Caption: Great chance! Sergi Darder (Lyon) collects a great pass inside the box, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.
19:02 Event: Foul by Zenit
19:09 Event: Yellow card by Zenit
19:13 Caption: Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Axel Witsel (Zenit St Petersburg) for his blatant foul.
19:22 Caption: Lyon earn a free kick which could lead to a goal-scoring opportunity.
19:53 Event: Direct free-kick by Lyon
19:54 Caption: Claudio Beauvue (Lyon) takes the free kick but it is cleared by the first defender. The ball goes out of play. Lyon are awarded a corner kick.
19:55 Event: Ball out of play
20:16 Event: Corner by Lyon
20:18 Caption: Mathieu Valbuena (Lyon) swings in the corner, but fails to find any of his teammates. One of the defenders reacts superbly to get it clear.
20:36 Event: Shots on target by Zenit
20:36 Caption: Danny (Zenit St Petersburg) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the right side of the net, but Anthony Lopes leaps like a salmon to deny him.
20:40 Event: Ball out of play
20:46 Event: Throw-in by Zenit
21:01 Caption: Alexandre Lacazette (Lyon) produces a lovely chip pass into the box, but one of the opposition players cuts it out.
21:03 Event: Shots on target by Lyon
22:27 Event: Shots on target by Lyon
22:29 Caption: Henri Bedimo (Lyon) zig-zags his way into the box and fails to direct a shot inside the left post. The goalkeeper pulls off a miraculous stop.
22:37 Event: Ball out of play
22:41 Event: Throw-in by Lyon
22:59 Caption: Mathieu Valbuena (Lyon) attempted to create a dangerous situation in front of goal by sending a cross into the box, but the defence easily dealt with the threat.
23:05 Caption: Mathieu Valbuena (Lyon) is offside and the linesman raises his flag.
23:25 Event: Shots on target by Lyon
23:33 Event: Offside by Lyon
24:06 Event: Indirect free-kick by Zenit
24:07 Caption: Goal! Hulk puts the ball on a plate for Artem Dzyuba (Zenit St Petersburg), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 0:1.
24:13 Event: Ball out of play
24:19 Event: Throw-in by Lyon
24:57 Event: Shots on target by Zenit
24:57 Event: Goal by Zenit
25:56 Event: Kick-off by Lyon
26:48 Event: Offside by Lyon
26:54 Caption: Christophe Jallet (Lyon) fails to beat the offside trap and the linesman puts his flag up.
27:10 Caption: Lyon are showing great team chemistry. They are passing the ball around seamlessly.
27:14 Event: Indirect free-kick by Zenit
28:33 Caption: A cross is clipped into the penalty area by Henri Bedimo (Lyon) but poses no threat.
28:35 Event: Ball out of play
28:51 Event: Throw-in by Zenit
29:34 Event: Shots off target by Lyon
29:34 Caption: Chance! Corentin Tolisso (Lyon) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Mathieu Valbuena, but his shot from inside the box flashes inches wide of the right post.
29:35 Event: Ball out of play
30:04 Event: Clearance by Zenit
30:25 Event: Ball out of play
30:34 Caption: Claudio Beauvue (Lyon) looks to break free, but an opposing player clears the ball away. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Lyon will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
30:46 Caption: The corner from Mathieu Valbuena (Lyon) is intercepted by the defence.
30:47 Event: Corner by Lyon
31:02 Event: Shots on target by Lyon
31:04 Event: Ball out of play
31:11 Caption: Mapou Yanga-Mbiwa (Lyon) can't believe his eyes as he blows an opportunity from close range. It looked really simple and he only needed to tap the ball in, but he failed. The ball goes well wide of the right post. Hang your head in shame son.
31:29 Caption: The referee had an easy-decision to make. A yellow card is given to Maxime Gonalons (Lyon) for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
31:38 Event: Clearance by Zenit
31:52 Event: Foul by Lyon
31:57 Event: Yellow card by Lyon
32:59 Caption: The game is interrupted now, Hulk (Zenit St Petersburg) picks up a knock and the physio has to come on.
33:10 Caption: Hulk (Zenit St Petersburg) seems to have picked up a minor injury, but it looks like he will be able to continue playing.
33:44 Event: Indirect free-kick by Zenit

34:04 Event: Foul by Zenit
34:08 Event: Indirect free-kick by Lyon

34:40 Caption: Christophe Jallet (Lyon) skips past his man but can't keep the ball in play. The ball goes out of play and Zenit will have a goal kick.
35:04 Event: Clearance by Zenit
35:20 Event: Shots off target by Lyon
35:21 Caption: Henri Bedimo (Lyon) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he fails to change the score as his effort deflects away off the bar.
35:39 Event: Ball out of play
35:54 Event: Corner by Lyon
36:09 Caption: Mathieu Valbuena (Lyon) slaloms his way past challenges, but an opposing player does well to get the ball away. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Lyon.
36:20 Event: Ball out of play
36:20 Caption: The resulting corner from Mathieu Valbuena (Lyon) is cleared by the defence.
36:46 Event: Clearance by Zenit
37:41 Caption: Alexandre Lacazette (Lyon) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Yuri Lodygin to get hold of the ball.

38:18 Event: Throw-in by Zenit
38:26 Event: Ball out of play
38:38 Event: Throw-in by Zenit

39:46 Event: Indirect free-kick by Lyon
39:54 Caption: Lyon string together a series of short passes.
40:11 Event: Ball out of play
40:23 Caption: Mathieu Valbuena (Lyon) attempts to slip the ball through the defence, but is unable to find any of his teammates. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Zenit.
40:40 Event: Clearance by Zenit
41:09 Event: Foul by Lyon
41:35 Caption: Danny (Zenit St Petersburg) is clearly asking for some medical attention with his painful gestures. The extent of his injury is yet to be discovered.
42:32 Caption: Danny (Zenit St Petersburg) is able to continue to play.
42:44 Event: Indirect free-kick by Zenit
43:24 Caption: Hulk (Zenit St Petersburg) looks to break free, but his touch lets him down and he loses the ball.
43:37 Event: Foul by Lyon

44:06 Event: Indirect free-kick by Zenit
45:27 Caption: Sergi Darder (Lyon) finds himself with a great opportunity! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box, which whizzes just wide of the left post!
46:45 Caption: Hulk (Zenit St Petersburg) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the middle of the goal. Anthony Lopes pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
46:59 Caption: The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
47:59 Caption: There was certainly plenty of action during that opening 45 minutes. Both teams are unsuccessfully trying to control the game and it's pretty even so far. The home side have dominated the possession and midfield so far. The visitors have spent most of their time defending and waiting for the right moment to launch counter-attacks.

48:59 Caption: According to the statistics, the match was pretty entertaining. There were plenty of thrilling moments. A very even game was seen on the pitch today. The home side's tactic was what is known as kick and rush football, while the away team adopted a counter-attacking style.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
In a clash that saw Lyon host Zenit St Petersburg, the home side was looking to make the most of their attacking prowess, while Zenit aimed to capitalize on their counter-attacking capabilities. The game kicked off with Lyon having the initial possession. Right from the start, it was evident that both teams were set to bring their A-game, each side eager to impose their rhythm on the match.

Just a minute and forty-five seconds into the game, Zenit committed their first foul, setting the tone for an aggressive encounter. Lyon quickly took an indirect free-kick, and the game proceeded with both teams striving to gain the upper hand. Zenit had their chance from a free-kick in the sixth minute after a foul by Lyon, but this early period of the game was marked by both sides making several errors and the ball often going out of play.

The high-intensity continued, with fouls and throw-ins shading the pace of the game. Zenit, keen on establishing dominance, took advantage of every opportunity. Domenico Criscito of Zenit showed early intent with an overhit through ball in the 10th minute, which resulted in a goal kick for Lyon. Criscito attempted another shot soon after, which, unfortunately for Zenit, ended up in the stands, much to the dismay or humour of the attending fans.

Both sides traded shots and missed opportunities during the opening exchanges. Lyon edged closer with a tantalizing chance when Sergi Darder tested the goalkeeper, who managed to pull off a solid save. The tension further mounted as Lyon’s Mapou Yanga-Mbiwa committed a harsh foul, earning Zenit a promising free-kick opportunity, which they, however, failed to convert into a goal.

Zenit’s Axel Witsel received the first yellow card of the game in the 19th minute for a blatant foul, leading to a goal-scoring chance for Lyon from a free-kick. Nevertheless, Lyon couldn’t make the most of it as their attempt was thwarted by the Zenit defense. As the game progressed, Zenit’s Danny came remarkably close to breaking the deadlock in the 21st minute, only to be denied by a sensational save from Anthony Lopes.

The first true turning point came in the 24th minute when Zenit capitalized on a defensive mix-up from Lyon. Hulk displayed his well-documented vision with a deft pass to Artem Dzyuba, who made no mistake from close range, putting Zenit 1-0 ahead. Lyon showed signs of frustration, noted by an offside decision against Christophe Jallet moments after the restart.

The resolute Zenit defense held strong against Lyon's subsequent advances. It wasn't until the 31st minute that Lyon had another clear chance, but Mapou Yanga-Mbiwa squandered a golden opportunity from close range, much to the agony of the Lyon supporters. Matters worsened for Lyon when Mapou Yanga-Mbiwa was booked for a foul, indicating rising frustration amongst the home side.

The rest of the first half saw Lyon making numerous attempts to equalize, their best chance coming just before the break when Alexandre Lacazette's shot proved a disaster from close range, easily collected by the keeper. As halftime approached, Zenit almost doubled their lead with another impressive effort from Hulk, which was aptly saved by Anthony Lopes. The first half ended with Zenit leading 1-0, leaving Lyon with everything to play for in the second half.

The second half began with Zenit maintaining their momentum. A series of fouls and yellow cards punctuated the early minutes, as Lyon’s desperation began to show. Domenico Criscito received a yellow card for a late challenge, setting off a series of bookings as the match progressed. Lyon had an indirect free-kick, but their subsequent cross was too close to Yuri Lodygin, who effortlessly gathered the ball.

The game's aggressive nature continued with Lyon committing fouls and Zenit making them pay via quick counters. Zenit’s Javi Garcia was booked, and the resulting free-kick by Mathieu Valbuena was comfortably dealt with by the Zenit defense. It wasn't long before another controversy arose with Aleksandr Anyukov receiving a yellow card for a foul. Lyon attempted to capitalize on this, but their shot was straight at the keeper again.

A brief spell of respite came when Zenit decided to throw on fresh legs, substituting Criscito with Igor Smolnikov. This strategic move aimed to bolster their defense and preserve their fragile lead. Lyon continued to press hard, and every now and then, they managed to conjure up some promising plays.

In the 48th minute, Zenit’s Hulk sent another pinpoint assist to Artem Dzyuba, who repeated his earlier composure and finesse to slot the ball home, making it 2-0 to Zenit. This goal was a massive blow to Lyon, who appeared flustered and disoriented thereafter. Zenit, now two goals to the good, seemed content to soak up pressure and hit Lyon on the break.

Lyon made several substitutions to inject fresh energy into their ranks, with Rafael replacing Christophe Jallet and later on, Maxime Gonalons receiving his marching orders for a second bookable offense. The dismissal further dampened Lyon's chances of mounting a credible comeback.

Zenit, sensing victory, opted for safety-first football, frequently clearing their lines and letting Lyon come at them. The home side's frustration was evident with attacks becoming increasingly desperate and less coordinated. Alexandre Lacazette continued to fight hard but found the Zenit defense more than a match for his talents.

In the dying moments of the game, Zenit lost Aleksandr Anyukov to a second yellow card, reducing the game to a ten-a-side contest. However, this dismissal came too late to have any significant impact on the match’s outcome. Lyon's Maxime Gonalons’s offside goal in injury time was the last piece of drama before the final whistle, which blew to confirm Zenit’s well-deserved 2-0 victory.

Throughout the match, Lyon had more ball possession and tried various attacking approaches, but Zenit's solid defense and clinical counter-attacks made the difference. Arthur Yusupov and Igor Smolnikov’s late inclusions helped Zenit tighten up their game, ensuring Lyon's attempts to get back into the matchup were continuously thwarted. Lyon tried crossing, long-range shots, and intricate passing moves but seemed unable to penetrate Zenit’s well-organized defensive schema.

Significantly, Anthony Lopes's repeated saves could only do so much to keep Lyon in the match. On the other hand, Zenit exhibited exceptional counter-attacking flair encapsulated by the effective duo of Hulk and Artem Dzyuba. This game truly highlighted the fine margins in football: Lyon had their share of opportunities but lacked Zenit's composure and efficiency in front of goal.

The match ended 2-0 in favor of Zenit St Petersburg, who utilized their fewer chances more effectively and showed more conviction in decisive moments to seal an impressive away victory in Lyon.
